clinical_study.brief_title: Effects Neuromuscular Taping Technique on Upper Limbs Edema in Cardiac Surgery Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects Neuromuscular Taping Technique on Upper Limbs Edema in Cardiac Surgery Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to verify the efficacy of the decompression technique of neuromuscular taping on cardiac surgery patients in whom edema of the upper limbs occurs due to post-operative water overload.

primary_outcome.measure: circumference's change of index finger, metacarpus, wrist, mid forearm, elbow and upper arm
primary_outcome.time_frame: measure in millimeter on first postoperative day: before application of tape; and then, every day for the first 3 days, after tape removing, and before the new application.
primary_outcome.description: measure tissue edema change by circumference change in specific site of the limb ( index finger, metacarpus, wrist, mid forearm, elbow and upper arm)

secondary_outcome.measure: measurement of the intensity of pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measure every day for the 3 days of treatment, before application of tape
secondary_outcome.description: measurement of the intensity of pain during mobilization of fingers, wrist and arm using a VAS scale( 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst possible pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: movement ability of wrist, hand and arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: measure every day for the 3 days of treatment, before application of tape
secondary_outcome.description: measure angle variation in pronosupination and flexion extension, ulnar and radial deviation of the wrist with articular goniometer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measure every day for the 3 days of treatment, before application of tape
secondary_outcome.description: measurement of the handheld gripping force by means of a dynamometer

intervention.description: neuromuscalar tape application in decompression technique (hand and arm)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac surgery patients with postoperative edema of the upper limbs due to water overload
Exclusion Criteria:
- absence of edema,
- previous mastectomy and lymphadenectomy,
- surgery or fractures or infection of the upper limb,
- previous or current deep vein thrombosis.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
responsible_party.investigator_title: principal investigator, anesthesiology and ICU medical doctor
